unit.name: 276 Volksgrenadier Division HQ
unit.History: Reconstituted during the autumn following almost complete destruction in Normandy and the retreat across France. Rebuilt around wounded veterans who had returned from the hospitals, the division was fairly young in terms of the conscription classes it represented and was at full strength when it moved west from Poland. Officers and NCO's had too little experience and training. Morale. poor to begin with, suffered from high casualities and the combat death of the much repected and liked commander.

commander.Name: Kurt MÃ¶hring
commander.PersBio: Commissioned as a lieutenant in the 5th artillery regiment of foot June1917 and discharged from military service in 1921 but on 1 July 1924 Morhring reentered Imperial Army service as a lieutenant, assigned to 1 (Preussisches) Infantry Regiment. May 1931 he commanded 9.Kompanie 1 (Preussisches) Infantry Regiment. He commanded III.Bataillon / 82nd Infantry Regiment for two years 1939 and 1941 where he earned the German cross in gold awarded Jan 1942, and then became commander of the 458th Infantry Regiment 1 Jan to 16 Feb 1942. Thereafter he commanded 82 Infantry Regiment 16 Feb to 6 Dec 1942 and earned the Knight's Cross awarded July 1943. This command was followed by the prestigious assignment as commander Infantry Regiment "Gross Deutschland" 6 Dec 1942 to 24 Dec 1943. From 24 Dec. 1943 to Jan 1944 he commanded 196 Infantry Division. He commanded 276 Volksgrenadier Division from 4 Sept. to 18 Dec 1944 when he was KIA on the road between HQ's and about to be relieved for the lack of progress by his division.
